comments.body: This would be great for changing such biomes like gravelly mountains which in my world I have completely covered in grass and birch trees but I still only get dandelions so I would enjoy other flowers

I would say this is a bad idea for survival worlds, but even worse for creative worlds. Sometimes, you pick a kind of biome, and build something that doesn’t fit into that biome, there, because they still go together. This could really mess up the ideas people have for worlds. I want to be able to change biomes, but I want full control over it, not to be controlled by it.

I agree with this Idea. As an rpg map builder that likes to make different regions and continents, I would very much like to have the ability in creative to change a biome of either very specific locations using XYZ to XYZ, or change the biome chunk by chunk or something like that. Right now its hard to sell that my superflat world’s mountainous snow biome is cold when the biome grass color is still vibrant plains-green and it rains instead of snows.
this has to be added! you could make seasons with command blocks!!!

I thought of this once I saw the notes for the java edition 23w03a snapshot for adding the "snow_golem_melts" tag and reflected on how, in the past, I would create a snow golem in a place and it would transform everything into somewhat of a snow land and how the snow golem melts in certain biomes now. I think this behavior would make a world more lively and would bring more opportunities to world development. Of course this behavior might not always be wanted but this could be made optional and specific to circumstances that would be ideal. I think this could make a biome become less rigid in the world and could develop slowly and be implied on areas that seem natural and appropriate.
Tell me if you have new ideas that would make this biome even better. I'm always open for new ideas!

Great idea! The plains ARE very boring and this would be cool.

 

Maybe there could be a rare natural event that occurs here: a hunting day. This is when Outlaws form a group and hunt both buffalo and coyotes. They would be neutral to the player at this time.

You have a vote from me!
Maby in thunderstorms there is a chance of a tornado occurring.
Golden eagles also fit here, as they hunt in fields and they are (or were) endangered due to reforestation, so they could be added to raise awareness.
I like this idea.

I really appreciated your idea! So much information and the picture helps a lot to understand the biome. The only thing that I don't think that makes sense is the boots because that can be too powerful to be added in the game.
Meh.

This biome idea is ok. Its good enough in and of itself, but it seems almost too chaotic. The enchantment is alright, but it needs some more purpose.

Verdict: This is interesting, but I don't think this has the potential to be a rewarding or fun biome in the game.

Lightning doesn't strike in the nether because there are no clouds. But an overworld biome with lots of lightning would be fun. Unfortunately, weather currently affects the entire world evenly, except for deserts.
Great biome! But I think some new stone types like Monzonite and Limestone, they would be like andesite, granite, and diorite but only occur in this biome
That deserves to be in Minecraft, maybe an abandoned, broken train track through the mountain ⛰
Amazing Idia! We could maybe put yettys in there too!!!
I'm thinking tiny ice spikes instead of mossy cobble boulders

Igloos and Taiga style villages and Pillager Outposts should generate there. Mobs would be snowy foxes, snowy rabbits, wolves and the default animals (sheep, cows, pigs and chickens). Temperature would be -0,25
Please! This will add much needed variety to snowy biones, and will look oh so pretty!! Please Mojang!
It'd be intresting, but I think it'd also be hard to add to Minecraft.
I agree

This would be a gamechanger. I completely agree. But I think it would have to involve a very large area of terraforming to do, otherwise it would be to easy. Also, when the biome is more than 100% terraformed, it would show signs of changing. such as water and grass changing slightly, and a rare amount of biome specific mobs spawning.
Some players may not want this, so it should probably be a gamerule, like /gamerule dobiomechange
It actually wouldn’t be incredibly difficult to implement, it would probably take a while to load a world, though.

I agree, this should be added, however, if you know anything about programming, it would cause a lag when saving and re-entering the world. It would have to check consistently to see if it is in line with the common blocks in the many biomes. Think about this, woodland mansions do the same thing. They check all the many different dark oak biomes and only spawn when it meets all the parameters. So, if this were to be implemented, it would have to have minimal parameters, and it may cause crashes, like if you were to put a jungle tree in a spruce tree biome. That would confuse the computer like crazy, so a little more thought may have to be put into this, but hey, good idea, and keep it up! ;)
What if they were to add an item similar to the conduit that allows you to change the environment
I agree
Why not have the main mushroom itself be made out of Nether Wart Blocks and the stem would be made out of Bone Blocks? That would seem more fitting.
We need this to be updated even after 1.16's nether update. very good idea.
It could maybe be an item that tames the warden and or can summon a warden at your will.

Forget the Warden! I think it should be some sort of ghost and/or sculk dragon! Once defeated, it should drop an egg that you can hatch, and the baby dragon would fight for you.  But your idea is also super cool :)
good idea. adding moss 2 boulders. i like it.
this only has as few votes as it does is because it's barely 2 and a half weeks old, this should get like thousands of votes, I wish I could vote more than once because I definitely would
If the concept art for the new update means anything, we might get this next year! The concept art showed updated Birch and Oak forests.

They need to keep the oak trees practicle whilst making tham look much nicer. This could done by done by adding some blocks at the bottom to be like roots but also adding more larger and more inticrate trees and other types of trees like willow. Forests in minecraft need more biodiversity.
Also, there should be structures in forests. The only one that generates there right now are ruined portals, which are fairly common.
save the Amazon rainforest!
Also good drawing

As a suggestion to raise awareness even more, add captbaras and pink river dolphins who are both endangered. Also adding some endangered plants like dead corpse lilies and lobster claw flowers would be sick for builders. I personally want to see pineapples and bromeliads in a tropical update.

Hmm I don’t know about the beacon destroying the bedrock partially but rather you make a corrupted beacon and put it above a piece of bedrock that is in a void temple. This temple would be guarded by corrupted but not as strong also I think there should be a void to defeat to get into the middle chamber (where the bedrock is) any back to the beacon and stuff. When the beacon activates it should blow up the bedrock making a corrupted portal leading to the void dimension ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ that’s just what I think please vote for this it’s amazing
Your idea was great! I took it into consideration and added that into the idea! Feedback is the best!
What's the mod you used for the image ?
Note that I also have this on r/minecraftsuggestions. Can't provide a link given the rules of this site, but it should be easy to find. The title is identical.
• Maybe it would do more damage, because blue colored heat is hotter. The one thing that passes by Fire resistance potions!
I agree, But i think it should just be a cosmetic thing. Would totally use in texture pack.

If you mean something like the biome color overlay that gets puts on water & leaves but for lava, then yes that sound fun

if it's a whole new block/fluid, then that sounds confusing imo

Soul fire does 2 times more damage than fire. so, if soul lava does the same, it would be very hard to pass soulsand valley because normal lava does an extreme damage. then, soul lava should be almost an instant death. also, if soul lava hits you, then you should be on "soulfired" that makes the damage so insane because combination of doubled damage lava and doubled damage fire. but, mojang said "soulsand valley" is the most deadly place in nether, so it should be makes sense.
Api Biru is hotter than regular lava in the real world so it would make sense to be in the Nether somewhere, but when collected it'll be regular lava or it'll be collected by a new type of bucket.

YAS! 

I really like this idea!this would be so cool to have in Minecraft! Great idea!

I like this idea 

I think that this need to be in the game to better sky but it should be rare like 200 or 300 days to don’t be so frequently this to the eclipses

In sooting stars like 10 or 20 days
the diamond part is a bit too OP but lets hope they make diamonds more common under the volcano but at diamond level
I would think that these volcanos would be in their own biome, The volcanic biome, with two variants, the active volcano biome, and the extinct volcano biome.
That sounds cool

I like the idea, but the amount of diamonds in the biome should only be a bit more than normal by making the ore veins in the biome a bit larger. The diamonds should spawn underground as surface diamonds would make normal diamond mining useless.
I also had this idea! Maybe the dormant volcanoes can have lots of obsidian
I think volcanic lakes are more suitable to have a lot of obsidian than dormant volcano.
I like this idea if it could be incorporated with larger than normal jungle trees as well to simulate excess water that would be cool.
Also, full water blocks should stop about 7 or 8 blocks out from the shore. That way, the water gets lower as it approaches the shore, making it appear like waves
Maby it could have a land counterpart called a volcanic jungle?

I need to specify that the tar(unhardened version) is coal blocks, tarred stone is bedrock and hardened tar looks like black concrete, please Mojang change the texture for these and make your own version and details shall you implement this. This is just so I don't have to make a texture pack.
I'm sorry if this isn't much feedback to your post, but: PURPLE!!!
Maby there could be a chance it spawns with fairy lights hanging from it’s branches
There is an actual place like this called White Sands Monument in New Mexico. It would be cool to see some variations to deserts.

Cool idea, but I think ruined portals are common enough in the new snapshots so there's no point adding another type. Still, I like the idea.

 

Verdict: Without a portal, this would be perfect! You have a vote.
Cool idea! Maybe the quartz in this biome could be different than nether quartz? Maybe you could make armour and tools out of it, or use it for enchanting?
Hi my name is Champmatthew and I posted 'White Desert Biome' and 'Gypsum Desert' a few days before this. Is this a repost or a copy of my idea?
Perhaps you would have to defeat a boss to gain access to it
I feel like this would fit in the end, though would that destroy the "Timeless" point of it?
hmm i dunno it seems that it wouldn't fit in the overworld it would fit more in the end
As others have said, this would perhaps fit better in the end as it already has a ‘timeless’ feel with end cities that have no real humanoid civilisation. However, it is still a fantastic idea.
Guys, dont judge his question. Plus, he worked so hard for this! And I think it is a great idea... at least compared to my only-two-vote idea.
